result.execSummary:
The defendant Arthur C Erdmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Must report to Probation today.
Concurrent with: With any other Probation.

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/cost to be paid to out of bond. Remainder of bond to be returned to poster.
Must provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.
May not possess/use firearms or body armor.

May not vote until civil rights are restored.
Cannot hold Elective Office.
May face deportationis not a US citizen or lose other citizen rights.

Must undergo Cognitive Programing.
Compas Eval and follow recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
Must serve 60 days - Starting no later than October 3, 2014.  Remainder of time is banked for Probation use. Subject to work release but NOT subject to Good Time.
Sentence Credit to be determined within 10 days.

CASES: 14CF148 & 14CF5. Defendant Arthur C Erdmann in court with attorney Brian Thomas Smestad.  Stephen C. Dorrance appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 10:48 am.  CT finds elig for substance abuse pgm, not elig for CIP.  
W/H sentence, probation 2 1/2 yrs.  Undergo cognitive pgm & follow recomm of compas.  $290.60 fine/costs.  DNA surcharge of $300 & must provide DNA sample.  Convicted felon-cannot possess firearm, no body armor, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elective office, if not US Citzen face deporation or lose other citizen rights.  Order 1 year conditional time, serve 60 days to start by 10/3/14, subj to WR, not subj to GT.  Remainder of time is banked.  Atty Smestad to provide court w/ credit for time served-10 days to file w/ the court.  Must report to probation today.  Probation runs concurrent w/ other probation.  
Bond to be applied to fine/costs.  Remainder of bond may be returned to poster.  11:56 am adj.
from Probation to Judge JLA

CASES: 14CF5 & 14CF148.  Defendant Arthur C Erdmann in court with attorney Brian T Smestad.  Daniel P Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 3:11 pm.  Exh 1-O&R.  Cannot possess firearm, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold public office, cannot possess body armor.  If not US citizen, face deportation.  
14CF148-Count 1-Def-guilty.  CT-adj guilty, judgement entered.  14CF5-DRI all counts for sentence & restitut.  Order PSI-long form, COMPAS, agent not be present.  PSI due 8/22.  Bond cont. 3:27 pm adj.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2014 at 10:30 am.

CASES:  14CF5 & 14CF148. Defendant Arthur C Erdmann in court with attorney Brian T Smestad.  Defendant Arthur C Erdmann in custody.  Daniel P Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 11:58 am. BS-ask to amend bond & would withdraw speedy trial request.  Steffen-argues modif.  CT-trial date of 6/25 is cancelled.  CT reduces bond to $1000 cash bond, covers both files.  All other conditions remain.  CT modifies face of bond.  Bond cont as modified.  12:09 pm adj.  Status conference scheduled for June 17, 2014 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Arthur C Erdmann in court with attorney Brian T Smestad.  Defendant Arthur C Erdmann in custody.  Stephen C Dorrance appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CASES: 14CF148/14CF5.
JB-clerk 1:13pm     Atty Smestad asking for bond review/qualifies - asking for a reduced bond - DEF on prob hold. State does not agree. CT FINDS: not modifying bond, SPH, sets hrg, bonds continue. adj 1:19pm  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

COVERS 14CF5 and 14CF148. NO GUNS. Not to possess or use drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant shall neither directly or indirectly threaten, harass, intimidate or otherwise interfere with victims or witnesses in this action.  Defendant shall give written notice to the Clerk of this Court within 48 hours of any changes of address or telephone number.  Subject to testing to determine compliance.  Not to commit any new crimes.  Must appear at all future court appearances.

Defendant Arthur C Erdmann in court with attorney Brian T Smestad by telephone means.  Defendant Arthur C Erdmann in custody.  Stephen C Dorrance appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
